a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of primary energy that is low-carbon vs. GDP per capita,
Low-carbon energy is the sum of nuclear and renewable energy sources. Gross domestic product (GDP) is measured in constant
international-$ which corrects for inflation and cross-country price differences.
Share of energy from low-carbon sources
Data source: Energy Institute Statistical Review of World Energy (2023); Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
